title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 155.3 - Fees; procedures in appeals after hearings
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 155.3 - Fees; procedures in appeals after hearings

State Regulations
(a) A fee of $10 which shall not be
refundable must be paid at the time an appeal is filed from a determination
made after a hearing. A transcript of such hearing shall be reviewed only if it
is submitted by the appellant. (b) Appeals from a determination based upon a hearing at which testimony was taken
may be submitted on a form and in the manner prescribed for such purpose by the
commissioner not later than 60 days from the date after written notice was
given of the determination appealed from, excluding the date of the
determination. The appellant has the option of having the transcript of the
hearing reviewed as a part of the appeal proceeding. If the appellant desires
to have the transcript reviewed, he must so indicate on the appeal form and he
must also submit the transcript for such review. The transcript shall not be
reviewed if a request for such review is not made and the transcript is not
submitted to the appeals board in timely fashion. Notes

155.3

Amended, New

York State Register March 19, 2014/Volume XXXVI, Issue 11, eff. 3/19/2014

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
